boardgame.name: Dune
Frank Herbert_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Dune
boardgame.description: Set thousands of years in the future, Dune the board game is based on the Frank Herbert novels about an arid planet at the heart of the human space empire's political machinations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Designed by the creators at Eon of 'Cosmic Encounter fame, some contend that the game can best be described as Cosmic Encounter set within the Dune universe, but the two games bear little in common in the actual mechanisms or goals; they're just both set in space. Like Cosmic Encounter, it is a game that generates player interaction through negotiation and bluffing._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players each take the role of one of the factions attempting to control Dune. Each faction has special powers that overlook certain rules in the game. Each turn players move about the map attempting to pick up valuable spice while dealing with giant sandworms, deadly storms, and other players' military forces. A delicate political balance is formed amongst the factions to prevent any one side from becoming too strong. When a challenge is made in a territory, combat takes the form of hidden bids with additional treachery cards to further the uncertainty._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game concludes when one faction (or two allied factions) is able to control a certain number of strongholds on the planet._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Note that the Descartes edition of Dune includes the Duel Expansion and Spice Harvest Expansion, the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Landsraad variant from Avalon Hill's General magazine, and additional character disks not provided by AH._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

I have an extra thrifted copy of the 1979 Sand Worm Cover edition of this game for sale. The box has some damage to it as you can see in the pictures. The box is fine other than the slight crushing you see in the pictures. In other words, it does not have any split corners. The game board, all of the cards, the instructions, and the player shields are all in great condition. The pad of player aid sheets is nearly full and in excellent condition. The combat wheels are slightly bowed but it does not affect their use at all and they are otherwise in excellent shape. As you can see in the pictures, the leader disks show wear from repeated use. This is because I swapped them out with my other copy. You may also notice in that picture that one of the leader disks (the 1-value Harkonnen leader) has been fabricated because the original was lost. As you can see the fabrication is of good quality and this will not affect game play at all. Also the Kwisatz-Haderach chit has been fabricated, but it is an excellent replacement and this does not affect game play at all. Finally, one of the Harkonnen and one of the Fremen troop chits are a little worn. The only piece the game is missing are the 2 clips that attach the two board pieces together. This can be substituted for but is not actually necessary to play the game. In sum, this is overall a very good condition player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s copy of the game. If you want to play the game it will work perfectly. If you are a collector, you will want to pass on this copy. I will ship world wide and via any method the buyer chooses. Let me know how you want to ship and I will give you a shipping quote. If you have any questions at all don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t hesitate to Geekmail me or send me an email at: sheltonious@yahoo.com

Please see the accompanying photos. This is a home made / professionally made copy of the boardgame Dune from 1979 using the many resources here on BGG. The board and counters were made for me by BGG_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Andrew Toulson. The board has a slightly shiny surface and each half is made up of three folding panels. The counters were printed on slightly gloss paper and stuck onto wooden disks. They are double-sided. There are also a dozen or so spare tokens. The box (also from A.T.) has some shelf wear. The cards were printed by ArtsCow and are like new. Deck 1: List of leaders for each player, blank cards, treachery cards (including about a dozen extras for the two expansions) Deck 2: Storm marker cards (optional), traitor cards, spice cards Deck 3: Bene Gesserit prediction cards, alliance cards, Quisatz Haderach cards Spice is represented by the yellow acryllic pieces. Small = 1 and large = 5 spice. The six shields are printed on card and are home made. The battle wheels are also home made. There are four but only two are needed. One pair are made from quite heavy card (like the original) and the other pair are made from thinner card and laminated. There are two different sets of wooden storm markers (labelled 1 to 6) which can be drawn by the Fremen player from the drawstring bag printed with the Dune map (also courtesy of ArtsCow). There are also alternative wooden storm markers (from the cards) and nuclear explosion markers. Rules and a crib sheet for the treachery cards are also included. Postage within the UK will be £5.50 by Royal Mail (_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;2kg, small parcel, tracked, 2-3 days, insured). Elsewhere, please ask. Payment by PayPal please unless you pay cash on collection from the Tadcaster / Leeds / York (UK) area.
